headline: Maple Salmon
description: These maple-glazed salmon fillets are marinated and baked in a tasty sauce made with maple syrup, soy sauce, and garlic for an easy but elegant meal.

video.description: This top-rated recipe is one of the best (and easiest!) ways to prepare baked salmon. In this video, find out how to make maple-glazed salmon with a simple maple syrup marinade. After 30 minutes, this dish goes right in the oven. That’s it!
video.name: Maple Salmon Recipe

name: Maple Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Stir maple syrup, soy sauce, garlic, garlic salt, and pepper together in a small bowl.

Cut salmon into 4 equal-sized fillets; place in a shallow glass baking dish and coat with maple syrup mixture. Cover the dish and marinate salmon in the refrigerator for 30 minutes, turning once halfway.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake salmon uncovered until flesh easily flakes with a fork, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: After years of trying to get the husband to eat salmon, I have now found three salmon recipes he will actually eat. This is one of the three and in fact I have it marinading right now and will be cooking in a few minutes. Thanks for giving me a salmon recipe he'll actually eat! It's delicious!

I made my own version from this recipe. I marinaded 2 fillets in a zip lock bag using fresh ginger, tamari sauce, minced garlic, avocado oil, and a splash of orange juice, and pepper. After 30 mins, I drained the fillets and padded dry with paper towels. I placed fish on foil in the air fryer, which was preheated to 400 degrees. I cooked for 10 mins, then, watched it closely, being careful not to overcook. In a saucepan, I brought pure maple syrup, freshly grated ginger, orange juice, a splash of balsamic vinegar, water, and tamari to a boil, then reduced it, to a thick glaze to pour over fillets. My husband raved about it!
Great taste and easy to make!
I’ve made this several times now and the entire family loves it!
I used a bourbon maple syrup. It was delicious and a big hit with my guests.
Very good flavor, followed the recipe exactly. I did cut the baking time to 15 minutes, and it was still overdone. In the future I'd cut it to 10.
I have made this recipe several times and it is always a winner. I am planning on using jalapeno maple syrup this time.
this is a classic… I like to add orange zest and Concentrate to my marinade along with some fresh ginger. Another great idea is bourbon barrel aged maple syrup.
This was delicious!
Awesome--My husband said "make this again.--No photo we ate it all
The maple syrup adds just the right amount of sweetness!
Love this recipe!! It's simple and tastes great! It's our go to recipe when not using lemon pepper recipe!!!
Just wasn't much flavor to this. We followed recipe to a T. Won't be making this again
My husband is not a huge fan of sockeye salmon, he loves it with this recipe!!
loved it
This is my go to salmon recipe! I love it and the best part is a always have these ingredients on hand. We try and eat salmon at least once a week.
My husband and I love this recipe. We serve it with sweet potatoes and a green salad.
Very good!
Left out the fresh garlic and used bourbon barrel maple syrup added a side of barbecue seasoned squash to the oven to cook along side. Quick and yummy.
Delish!

I can't believe I have not rated this recipe yet. It is a dish I often cook for my family as we eat salmon once /week. Use various recipes but this is one of our favorites ! You definitely need a good quality maple syrup to enjoy salmon cooked this way, don't use the fake maple syrup ! Thank you for sharing this delicious recipe, will be passed down to generations in my family!
So good, I added a little bit of garlic powder and onion powder and it was amazing!
Absolutely delicious! I sub Bragg liquid Amino’s for the soy due to dietary restrictions. I make this at least once a week.

Easy to make and really good. Family loved it. The leftovers can make a wonderful cold salmon salad, adding a bit of mayo, chopped onion, finely diced celery, or whatever else you like. My son took the salmon skin, fried it and it was great too. Versatile and easy, your mid-week supper when you don't want to spend too much time in the kitchen. Note, be sure you cook to a core temp of 145 F measured at the thickest portion of the fillets.

Pretty much foolproof, and I say that as a male engineer with abysmal cooking skilz. (*) Extremely tolerant of disobeying the instructions. Just aim for that marinade, don't panic, don't even worry about measuring the proportions exactly, or the quantity of fish, or chopping it up, or how long to marinate. (*) I've made it twice, and not only have I not killed anyone, I've gotten compliments. (*) three parts maple syrup to one part soy sauce, and some garlic salt. Do not sweat the details: it's going to turn out fine. I have just done this to a $65 Copper River Salmon filet, and I didn't worry at all. It turned out great.
Soooo yummy! However, I decided to omit 5 minutes off of the cooking time and throw it in the broiler for the last 5 minutes instead so that the tops can crisp up. *chefs kiss*
I cut back on the maple syrup and added an ounce of Bourbon. I also cut the soy in half. Came out great with a Parmesan couscous.
This is my all time favorite way to prepare salmon! It’s quick and easy and it tastes amazing!
😊Delicious flavor, easy to make.

The only change I made was to double the sauce as everyone enjoys it so much they like a little extra and quite often pour a bit on the rice which I usually make to accompany the salmon This is a go to for company and I have never found anyone who doesnt ask for the recipe after tasting it.
I have made this several times. All with a fabulous result. I did not like salmon till I tried this recipe. It has become a regular meal in my home. Easy, quick and healthy.
My go-to salmon prep is miso, soy sauce, rice wine, and sesame oil. I was out of miso and decided to try something different. I will not try this again. So disappointing. Blech.
Very tasty.

I just made this, and it's fabulously good AND easy. I didn't bother with the clove of garlic out of sheer laziness, so I just added more garlic powder. I DID add some pureed ginger because I like it, but I don't think I even noticed it. I let it marinate for about one and a half hours in the fridge, turning it from side to side, and it worked out well. I made an extra portion to have tomorrow for lunch, but it got eaten😏 Even the cat loved it, and she usually resents change - that, my friends, is testament to how good this recipe is: it's cat approved!
Made salmon using this recipe more than once and now it's the only way I'll make salmon...YUM!
I've done this or very similar for years! It's great!
Delicious!
Very tasty!
I don't eat salmon but both of my adult children do & they really liked this recipe. Asked me to use it again.
Excellent as written, have made this recipe for years. This is a keeper! Turns out perfect every time.
Well, maybe ok but after 15 minutes at 400 degrees the maple syrup starts to burn and smoke a lot. Enough to set off the smoke detectors. So… not a favorite.
Awesome flavor! Easy to prepare. Everyone loved!

I really enjoyed the flavor of the sauce! I followed the recipe, but used garlic powder instead of garlic salt. Also used low-salt soy sauce. I love sweet, but I wanted some heat to balance the taste, so I added about 1/4 tsp of crushed red pepper. Spicy sweet perfectly cooked salmon.
I made this recipe with fresh skin-on portion of salmon and it was delicious. The maple and garlic flavors were quite nice together without being overpowering, and the salmon was flaky and tender.
I have made this recipe twice. It was a big hit with the hubs. Will definitely make again and again.

This is a simple, quick recipe that tastes absolutely fabulous. I think real maple syrup makes a difference and gives it great flavor. I also used teriyaki soy sauce. I can’t wait to make it for company.

Amazing! It's so easy to make and delicious. We have this every week at my house. My husband and I have made it with salmon and trout. Both work. We've also added ground ginger and sesame oil to the marinade. 10/10
Soooo tasty, quick, easy, and fail proof! Love it!
This turned out perfect! I substituted honey for syrup and I chopped one clove of garlic. My salmon was really thick so I had to cook it for 30 minutes at 400. So mouth watering!
This is a very simple and tasty recipe! the salmon came out tasting sweet and a bit garlicy. my family loved it!
Delicious, my family loved it! Will definitely be making this again.

It was fabulous! My husband ate 4 pieces and we finished it off, a whole 1.25 lbs. I made Jasmine rice in the IP and I made frozen mixed veggies in the wok. We’re trying to work up to fish 3x a week instead of fish pills as his Dr. recommended. We’re well on our way.
My husband says it’s the best salmon he’s ever had. I followed the directions exactly. Thank you so much!!!

I added paprika , lemon pepper , garlic powder for 15 minutes.
Finished with a broil of brown sugar and primal kitchen teriyaki and primal kitchen spicy brown mustard
Delicious
I love this recipe and I usually double the sauce. It tastes great.
My family really enjoyed this maple salmon recipe. We had it with rice and asparagus. We'll definitely be having it again as it was so simple yet so good!
This has become my go to for Salmon. It's fabulous. I don't change a thing.

I have made this recipe over 20 times in the several years since I found it - it's one of the only salmon recipes I use anymore. Important tweaks: Instead of garlic salt, use garlic powder and increase the soy sauce for more salt. I also sprinkle in a bit of onion powder and a lot of fresh pepper, sometimes fresh herbs like rosemary if I have them, and triple the garlic. After marinading, SAVE THE SAUCE! Baking it in the oven with the fish destroys it. Simmer in a nonstick pan while the fish cooks until it's thick and syrupy. After the fish comes out, take the sauce off the heat and quickly stir in a good knob of cold butter. Serve sauce over the fish, rice, and a veggie like broccoli. One of my favorite easy meals. I've made this with small fillets and whole sides of salmon, increasing the marinade/sauce as needed. The cook time depends on the size of the fish, but following the recipe will usually give you overcooked fish.
Fantastic! Thanks sir the recipe

Best Salmon recipe I’ve cooked. I followed the menu with one variation. I had a Maple Hickory Rub in the cupboard that I placed on the Salmon for two hours before. Then added the Marinade 30-40 minutes before baking…. I cooked in a convection oven and use instant read thermometer to avoid over cooking…….OUTSTANDING!!!

Fish is recommended to be marinated for no greater than 30 minutes when there is acid in the marinade (lemon, vinegar, etc). This marinade/glaze has none so the longer it sits the more flavour. Acid will "cook" the fish as in ceviche

Zero stars. This is an ignominious combo for salmon. I am so annoyed that I ruined my favorite fish the ingredients suggested. I will have to
Force myself to eat it.
Best salmon we’ve had! Hubby said better than restaurant salmon!
Have made this twice now and received rave reviews. Don’t change a thing!
I will definitely will be making this again! I absolutely enjoyed the flavors of the seasonings and maple syrup blends so good together. It is now my favorite way for cooking salmon.
Since my wife doesn't like maple syrup, I used honey instead with a touch of Dejon. It was wonderful.
I added Scallions before I cooked. Lemon Pepper instead of normal pepper.

Instead of in the oven I put in on a barbeque grill mat, using a spoon to keep pouring the leaking away sauce back on top until it started caramelizing.
Absolutely best salmon I've ever had.

Every time I cook salmon this is the only recipe I use my whole family LOVES it! My husband doesn’t really like salmon too much because of the fishy taste but he loves this recipe so it’s the only one I use! I cook my salmon at 350 for 20min but that’s because that’s the thickness of my salmon
make lots of extra sauce, to then reduce in a pan and pour over the top and it makes a great sauce
This is an excellent marinade! I don’t change a thing and it comes out perfect every time.

I thought it was quite good. Although it is sweet, the soy sauce adds contrast with unami and saltiness. You could go less with the syrup if needed. I like garlic so I would add a little extra. My side dish was steamed broccoli which tasted good to dip in the marinade. I wish I made a little extra, because I ran out for the last bit of broccoli to dip in.
Excellent. Simple and easy to remember. Tastes great!

This is one of my favorites fish recipes. I bake it in a pouch and use the juices as a sauce. Also use the juices to make a rice side dish with toasted walnuts and craisins. Along with a side of candied carrots (cooked carrots with brown sugar). Especially good in the fall and winter months. Thank you for this brilliant recipe with maple syrup!
Delicious

I made this last night and thought it was really good. Based on another reviewer I started checking it at 15 mins. And it was perfect at about 17 or 18. I don’t know the exact size of the piece I had. Thanks so much for this recipe. I’ll most likely make it again.
Double the syrup mixture... this is my ‘go-to’ once a week and it is delicious with rice and mixed vegetables.
it was delicious

Have used this recipe several times and it’s always delicious. I usually omit the garlic salt and add half a clove more of garlic. With the saltiness of the soy sauce it doesn’t need it. I’ve also make it with half maple syrup, half monk fruit syrup and it was just as good.
I thought this dish was very tasty only thing was it wasn't lobster LOL!! but really enjoyed this wasn't to hard to make but I enjoy seafood a lot
My fiancé’s family loves it! It turned out fantastic
Loved it! Salmon is not my husband’s favorite but he loved this... so I get more salmon!!
This Maple Salmon was amazing! My husband was skeptical about the maple syrup, but it was subtlety sweet. I can't wait to make this again!
This recipe is really good. I wasn't sure about the maple syrup marinade, but it was delicious. I will definitely make it again.

Followed exactly. Super easy. Super delicious! My husband and son went salmon fishing in Alaska and we have tons of fish! This is our TOP recipe for salmon and we prepare it several different ways. The sauce pairs perfectly with steamed broccoli.
Followed the recipe but after 20 minutes it still wasn’t cooked. Cooked for an additional 15. Very tasty.
Made as written. Wonderful.Kids loved it.

This was absolutely delicious. I live in Auckland, New Zealand. A HUGE shout out for this recipe. Simple & Yummy. 

MUST TRY for any Salmon lover.
Meh. Move on
The best salmon recipe Ive ever made. Next time Im going to take the suggestions from another reviewer and make the baked carrots, rice pilaf to make it a complete meal.
This is the best salmon recipe ever! I’m not much of a fish lover but this is fantastic! I let mine marinade all day or overnight.
Yum yum. I coated all sides and baked. I used Kentucky Kernal... kinda feel off... dang it.
Absolutely wonderful even if you can’t marinade the entire time!

Made this for the first time this evening. I am a foodie and was excited to try this, but my oldest does not like sauces and my youngest does not like salmon. They both really enjoyed it and said to save this recipe to make again. Super easy to make and very tasty!!
Excellent as written ! Served with rice and used the extra marinade over the rice.

This was very good but if I was to make it again, I would place the salmon in tin foil and snug it up against the salmon, then pour the sauce over. A lot of the sauce gets lost as written and the pan is hard to clean but I would like more sauce to stay with the salmon.
great recipe, i make it quite often. I did find first time i made that 20 minutes at 400 was too long for 1 lb filet. Ever since, 15 minutes at 400 has come out perfect.

This is a very easy and delicious recipe. My whole family enjoys it. I used to buy a marinade but this is simple and much healthier. I just add some sliced mushrooms around the edges when baking and just top with some scallions and sesame seeds to finish.
